newsitem.title: USA: CME FEEDER CATTLE OFF SHARPLY AFTER GRAIN REPORT.
newsitem.headline: CME FEEDER CATTLE OFF SHARPLY AFTER GRAIN REPORT.

text.p: CME feeder cattle futures fell sharply at the start with September and October tumbling for limit losses of 1.500 cents per lb shortly after the start. Live cattle followed, traders said.

Feeders were pressured by the USDA crop production report which indicated much smaller-than-expected U.S. corn output this year at 9.276 billion bushels. The figure knocked feeder cattle futures down through technical support and touched off sell stops.
The report is expected to boost corn futures as much as up the 12-cent-a-bushel limit.
Live cattle followed feeders lower but the spot month showed underlying support following reports of increased packer interest for fed cattle and bottoming action in boxed beef prices, traders said.

At 0911 CDT, feeder cattle were 0.700 to 1.125 cent per lb lower with August off the least at 80.100 cents. September posted a limit loss of 78.975 and October a limit loss of 79.650 cents before recovering somewhat.
Live cattle stood 0.100 to 0.450 cent lower with August off the least at 65.550 cents.
